Clinical samples must be transported to the laboratory in packaging appropriate for level-2 biological risk inside a leak-proof cryogenic box and with a clearly visible biohazard label
33 . The samples can be stored at 2-8°C for up to 72 hours after collection. If the sample needs to be stored for long, it must be done at a temperature of at least -70°C. The extracted nucleic acid must also be stored at the same minimum temperature of -70°C
29 .
